cd6767b5-c8cc-4526-a4ed-202ffc82070c.description: Candidates can earn an MSSC, certification in Safety 4.0, by successfully passing this assessment. The assessment is based upon the MSSC industry-defined core skill standards and certifications needed for production technicians within all sectors of manufacturing. The standards are comprised of Key Activities and related Performance Indicators in which certificants need to demonstrate competency. This course includes, emerging industrial 4.0 technologies.
cd6767b5-c8cc-4526-a4ed-202ffc82070c.name: Safety CPT 4.0 Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: Safety 4.0 assessments are based on the following skills: 1-Safe and productive workplace 2-Safety & environmental assessments 3-Emergency drills & emergency teams 4-Identify unsafe conditions and take corrective action 5-Safety training 6-Equipment safety training 7-Processes and procedures that support safety of work environment 8-Safety & health requirements for maintenance, installation & repair 9-Safe equipment and operator performance 10-Safety-enhancing workplace practices.

The candidate will be recognize through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the foundational, core competencies of advanced manufacturing production. Candidates will be prepared for positions ranging from entry-level to front-line supervisor. This is one of four courses designed for candidates to earn the MSSC CPT 4.0 certification. The courses are Safety, Quality Practices & Measurement, Manufacturing Processes & Production and Maintenance Awareness.

15767446-6777-4fee-9d85-c78d05603403.description: The purpose of the Certified Logistics Associate (CLA) ® certification program is to recognize through certification, individuals who demonstrate mastery of the core competencies of material handling at the front-line (entry-level to front-line supervisor) through successful completion of the certification assessments. Candidates will learn the foundational knowledge required in logistic environments. This course is Part 1 of the MSSC Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) program.
15767446-6777-4fee-9d85-c78d05603403.name: Certified Logistics Associate (CLA) Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The Certified Logistics Associate (CLA) assessment is based upon the following skills: 1-Global supply chain logistics life cycle 2-Logistics environment 3-Material handling equipment 4-Safety principles 5-Safe material handling and equipment operation 6-Quality control principles 7-Workplace communications 8-Teamwork and workplace behavior to solve problems 9-Using computers. This is an online proctored assessment.

The candidate will be recognized through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the foundation competencies required in today's logistics environment. Candidates will be prepared for positions ranging from entry-level to front-line supervisor. The Certified Logistics Associate (CLA) course is the first of two classes that will earn the candidate the full MSSC Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) certification.

52f64a6b-654b-4363-8ee5-510f3e0086a2.name: Quality Practices and Measurements CPT 4.0 Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Quality Practices & Measurement 4.0 assessments are based on the following skills: 1-Internal quality audit activities 2-Calibration of gages & other data collection equipment 3-Continuos improvement 4-Inspection of material & production 5-Quality tests 6-Communication of quality problems 7-Corrective action 8-Process outcomes & trends 9-Fundaments of blueprint reading 10-Measurment systems & precision measurement tools.

The candidate will be recognize through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the foundational, core competencies of advanced manufacturing production. Candidates will be prepared for positions ranging from entry-level to front-line supervisor. This is one of four courses designed for candidates to earn the MSSC CPT 4.0 certification. issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: Manufacturing Processes & Production 4.0 assessments are based on the following skills: 1-Customer needs 2-Production equipment operation 3-Resourses and the production process 4-Set up production equipment 5-Team goals 6-Job assignments 7-Coordination of workflow with team 8-Communication of requirements & specifications 9-Perform, monitor, document processes 10-Compliance to customer requirements 11-Prepare final product

The candidate will be recognize through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the foundational, core competencies of advanced manufacturing production. badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance Awareness 4.0 assessments are based on the following skills: 1-Preventive maintenance (PM) and routine repair 2-Monitor indicators to ensure correct operation 3-Housekeeping to maintain production schedule 4-Recognize potential maintenance issue's with production systems 5-Communication

The candidate will be recognize through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the foundational, core competencies of advanced manufacturing production. ccdd3760-6a4b-42e2-8419-f18ccc622ae0.description: The purpose of the Certified Production Technician (CPT) ® 4.0 certification program is to recognize through certification, individuals who demonstrate mastery of the foundational, core competencies of advanced manufacturing production at the entry-level to front-line supervisor through successful completion of the certification assessments. The goal of the CPT 4.0 certification program is to raise the level of performance of production technicians.
ccdd3760-6a4b-42e2-8419-f18ccc622ae0.name: Certified Production Technician (CPT) 4.0 Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The MSSC CPT 4.0 certification is designed for candidates that have completed and earned their credentials in the MSSC Safety 4.0, Quality Practices & Measurement 4.0, Manufacturing Processes & Production 4.0 and Maintenance Awareness 4.0 courses. See the description, skills and activities from this website, for information on these four assessment courses.

bad86e7a-981d-49c7-9f4c-912d228e8c0c.description: The purpose of the Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) ® certification program is to recognize through certification, individuals who demonstrate mastery of the core competencies of material handling at the front-line (entry-level to front-line supervisor) through successful completion of the certification assessments. Candidates will learn the mid-level knowledge required in logistic environments. Candidates must earn the MSSC Certified Logistics Associate (CLA) certification prior to program
bad86e7a-981d-49c7-9f4c-912d228e8c0c.name: Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) assessment is based upon the following skills: 1-Receiving products 2-Stocking product 3-Processing product orders 4-Preparing packages for shipping 5-Shipping products 6-Inventory control 7-Safe handling of hazardous materials 8-Transportation modes 9-Perform dispatch, routing and tracking operations 10-U.S. measurements 11-Metric system conversion. This is an online proctored assessment.

The candidate will be recognized through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the mid-level competencies required in today's logistics environment. Candidates will be prepared for positions ranging from entry-level to front-line supervisor. The Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) course is the second of two classes that will earn the candidate the full MSSC Certified Logistics Technician (CLT) certification.

4eee791a-4a55-4f6b-9b72-e71080c0ef94.description: The MSSC Certified Technician-Supply Chain Automation (CTSCA-EM) Equipment Maintenance course, is one of three nationally portable, industry-wide, stackable certifications under the CTSCA System. The purpose of the program is to prepare technicians who install, operate, support, upgrade, and maintain the automated material handling equipment and systems supporting the supply chain. Students that complete the 200 hour CTSCA-EM course, will have the knowledge to maintain equipment and systems.
4eee791a-4a55-4f6b-9b72-e71080c0ef94.name: Certified Technician-Supply Chain Automation (CTSCA-EM) Equipment Maintenance Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The CTSCA-EM Equipment Maintenance online assessment and performance hands-on assessment is derived from the following skills: 1-Equipment removal/safety protocols 2-Operation of automated equipment/systems 3-Monitor equipment 4-Component inventory 5-Implement PM 6-Perform PM 7-Equipent scheduling 8-Lubrication 9-Hand tools 10-Communication 11-Record keeping 12-Measurement.

3d4b4609-c897-4dfa-8d43-3bdb6275088f.description: The MSSC Manufacturing CPT+ certification is built upon MSSC’s well-established Certified Production Technician (CPT) ® course. The CPT+ Skill Boss program is designed to prepare certificants with the next generation skills to work in a computer-driven, data-intensive, advanced manufacturing workplace. Individuals earn a certificate in Manufacturing CPT+ by passing a hands on assessment. “Skill Boss” is a computer-controlled machine that performs functions aligned with MSSC’s National Standards
3d4b4609-c897-4dfa-8d43-3bdb6275088f.name: Manufacturing Processes & Production CPT+ Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The Skill Boss machine enables MSSC® to offer hands-on training and assessment for MSSC Manufacturing CPT+ certification, as an enhancement to its signature Certified Production Technician (CPT) ® course. “Skill Boss” is a computer-controlled machine that performs a wide variety of functions aligned with 55+ skills drawn from the MSSC’s National Production Standards. This is a hands-on performance assessment.

skills.name: Use HMI To Manually Operate Parts

2aed1756-0d95-484b-8205-6eb58c0ec361.description: The MSSC Certified Technician-Supply Chain Automation (CTSCA-ER) Equipment Repair course, is one of three nationally portable, industry-wide, stackable certifications under the CTSCA System. Students that complete the 200 hour CTSCA-ER course, will have the knowledge to install, modify, troubleshoot and repair

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The CTSCA-ER Equipment Repair online assessment and performance hands-on assessment is derived from the following skills: 1-Troubleshoot machine, mechanical system, electrical system failures 2-Troubleshoot hydraulic systems 3-Troubleshoot pneumatic systems 4-Prepair for repair 5-Repair machine, mechanical system, electrical system failures 6-Repair hydraulic systems 7-Repair pneumatic systems 8-Interpret part and assembly drawings 9-Install, move or remove equipment

badge_template_activities.title: The Green assessment is based on the following skills: 1- Train in environmental issues. 2- Implement & promote environmental programs, projects, polices/procedures. 3- Conduct environmental incident & hazard investigations. 4- Conduct preventive environmental inspections. 5- Monitor environmental aspects during production. 6- Implement continuous improvement in environmental assurance practices. 7- Use advance materials in production to reduce weight and increase life. 8- Recycle materials

The candidate will be recognize through successful certification, that they demonstrate mastery of the foundational, core competencies of advanced manufacturing production. Candidates will be prepared for positions ranging from entry-level to front-line supervisor. .

7b7c5f4e-4f5d-4493-9894-851c2181cfbc.description: MSSC Certified Technician-Supply Chain Automation (CTSCA-NR) Network Repair course, is one of three nationally portable, industry-wide, stackable certifications under the CTSCA System. This program will prepare technicians to install, operate, support, upgrade, maintain the automated material handling equipment and systems supporting the supply chain. Students that complete the 200 hour CTSCA-NR course, will have the knowledge to install, modify, troubleshoot, repair basic controllers/networks
7b7c5f4e-4f5d-4493-9894-851c2181cfbc.name: Certified Technician-Supply Chain Automation (CTSCA-NR) Network Repair Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The CTSCA-NR Network Repair online assessment and performance hands-on assessment is derived from the following skills: 1-Install and maintain PLCs and PLC modules 2-Troubleshoot and repair PLCs with discrete I/O PLC modules 3-Modify, troubleshoot, manipulate, test, verify standard PLC programs 4-Install, maintain, troubleshoot PLC systems with variable frequency AC drives 5-Operate, test, run network, communication, scanners, run systems.

fbbd1807-0818-49c7-8c0e-11b977d66992.description: The purpose of the Certified Forklift Technician (CFT) program is to certify and recognize individuals who demonstrate core competencies involved in the maintenance, service, and repair of forklift vehicles. This course will provide skills to entry level forklift technicians, enhancing their performance in the world of material handling. The CFT prepares individuals to repair and maintain technical systems utilizing key engineering principles that underpin most forklift vehicles.
fbbd1807-0818-49c7-8c0e-11b977d66992.name: Certified Forklift Technician (CFT) Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Manufacturing Skill Standards Council

badge_template_activities.title: The CFT program consists of 55 hour course, an online pre-qualification assessment and a performance based hands-on assessment, based upon the skills listed on this page. Individuals demonstrate their understanding of the skills and knowledge through one assessment. Delivered online, this assessment contains 92 multiple-choice questions. Once the candidate has passed, they earn a CFT Pre-Qualification Award and can then move on to the hands-on assessment to earn the Full CFT certification.
